image.altText: Dhirren Randhawa walks down stairs.

props.synopsis: 19-year-old Dhirren Randhawa pleads guilty to aggravated driving without due care and leaving the scene of an accident following the death of Charlie Stevens at Schoolies celebrations in November.

title.children: Teenage driver pleads guilty to lesser charges over death of SA Police Commissioner's son

image.altText: Man leaning on balcony railing with coffee cup, looking out to sea, small wallaby marsupial behind him, coastal background

props.synopsis: Ron Taylor lives most of the year wandering around his island home in solitude, living off-grid away from the pressures of the rat race. It's a "great lifestyle".

title.children: Ron could be a modern-day Gilligan living on his isolated island. But he has no desire to be rescued

image.altText: An artist's impression of a housing project at Seaton in Adelaide's west.

props.synopsis: Housing measures in South Australia's upcoming budget include another relaxation of stamp duty, and funds for more than 1,900 homes across suburban Adelaide — but hundreds of tenants will be forced to move when properties are demolished.

title.children: Hundreds of new SA homes get big budget boost, as stamp duty abolished for first-time buyers of new homes

image.altText: Side of a green building with a sign that reads Precious Cargo Montessori Early Learning alongside three little cars

props.synopsis: Childcare chain Precious Cargo — which has seven operating centres across Adelaide —  is searching for a new buyer after going into voluntary administration this week.

title.children: Montessori childcare chain in SA goes into voluntary administration

image.altText: A white-haired woman in blue cardigan holds a tea-cup in both hands.

props.synopsis: Dee O'Loughlin says she considered calling a taxi when she fell ill to avoid paying for an ambulance call-out fee — and contemplates strategies like skipping meals to manage the rising cost of living.

title.children: 'Your heart plummets': SA pensioners hesitant to call ambulances over fee fears

image.altText: An image of 'fake graffiti' in Paris - two spidermen, one Europe, the other US fighting over who to help Ukraine.

props.synopsis: A pro-Russian campaign is targeting Australian news organisations, including the ABC, according to international researchers.

title.children: ABC and Australian news outlets are in the crosshairs of a pro-Russian influence operation

image.altText: Northern Minerals

props.synopsis: An Australian company that runs a strategically crucial heavy rare earth project has been revealed to have been targeted in a cyber attack as Treasurer Jim Chalmers ordered Chinese investors be removed.

title.children: Rare earths miner targeted in cyber attack prior to removal of Chinese investors

image.altText: A large white cruise ship is parked at a berth.

props.synopsis: The Australian travel brand will fold its operations into parent company Carnival Cruise Line from March 2025, leaving passengers with cruises booked on the Pacific Explorer after that date to receive a refund or credit.

title.children: P&O Cruises Australia to shut its doors after 90 years, leaving Pacific Explorer to be retired

image.altText: Packets of Tim Tam biscuits on a shelf, with a price tag saying $11.70

props.synopsis: The cost of living has increased more sharply in regional areas than in the cities, with some outback residents paying double for essential goods like food and fuel. Now the federal government is coming up with a plan to try to level the playing field, but will it work?

title.children: Is this Australia's most expensive town? Tim Tams cost $11.70 a packet or more than $1 a biscuit

image.altText: Roll clouds in the sky.

props.synopsis: A strange cloud formation known as roll clouds have appeared in the skies across eastern NSW. Many Sydney residents have taken to social media sharing photos of the formation and questioned what the clouds are.

title.children: Rarely seen clouds have materialised over Sydney, but what are they?

image.altText: Andrew Cobby sits in the back of a police car.

props.synopsis: Andrew Cobby, who was found guilty of murdering his wife, says he should be granted an appeal after "dramatic" changes to DNA were uncovered in a review.

title.children: Andrew Cobby challenges murder conviction over DNA lab bungle

image.altText: Man in white shirt holds his hand up high.

props.synopsis: A performance artist was taken away by police in Hong Kong on the eve of the Tiananmen Square crackdown anniversary as security remains tight in the city.

title.children: Hong Kong detains artist, vigils held to keep Tiananmen Square memory alive

image.altText: A man stands tall (left) next to three young children (right) in front of rock on a hiking trail.

props.synopsis: Two young brothers and their cousin made the discovery of a lifetime whilst hiking in North Dakota — a T-rex bone poking out of the ground.

title.children: Three young boys, the most famous dinosaur in history, and a prehistoric discovery that left them speechless

image.altText: Underworld figure Tony Mokbel is lead into a prison van at the Melbourne Supreme Court on October 18, 2011.

props.synopsis: Immigration Minister Andrew Giles reveals he is considering whether to cancel the visa of a Melbourne gangland figure, who the Administrative Appeals Tribunal allowed to stay in the country just yesterday.

title.children: Giles considering cancelling visa of alleged Tony Mokbel family associate

image.altText: A woman and her dog in a tractor

props.synopsis: When farmer Melissa Smyth's not out on her property on the South Australian-Victorian border, she can be found painting or creating mosaics in her shed. Her new-found passion for art was sparked by what's known as the Pinnaroo Project.

title.children: This farming town has found a way to reduce depression and improve wellbeing in the bush

image.altText: Child drawing with crayons

props.synopsis: Almost three quarters of a billion dollars will be sunk into early childhood learning in South Australia as the state moves to implement the recommendations of the recent royal commission, including the rollout of universal preschool for three-year-olds.

title.children: Major funding pledge for preschool in SA following Gillard royal commission

image.altText: Brett Allford wearing a black hat and black sunglasses

props.synopsis: A former South Australian cricket and football umpire has been jailed for sending Uber Eats and make-up to overseas girls in exchange for sexual photos – with his youngest victim being 11-years-old.

title.children: Former SA sporting umpire jailed for sending gifts to girls in exchange for sexual images

image.altText: A smiling young man with short, dark hair sits with his back to a bushy valley.

props.synopsis: Kye Schaefer, 21, died early last month in Coffs Harbour. A 36-year-old man has been charged with murder.

title.children: Murder charge laid after young surfer found stabbed in beachside car park

image.altText: A man presses his hands together in prayer

props.synopsis: India's election has been a Herculean exercise involving 15 million polling officials and security personnel, 1 million polling stations, more than 8,000 candidates and 744 political parties. Here's what to expect next.

title.children: 'Sent by God': Narendra Modi concludes a 45-hour meditation as he awaits a verdict on his decade in power

image.altText: Holly Valance smiling on left of screen and Nigel Farage at a podium on the right.

props.synopsis: Pro-Brexit campaigner and politician Nigel Farage steps back into front-line politics, announcing he will lead the right-wing Reform Party as a candidate in the upcoming British general election.

title.children: Former Neighbours star backs Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage in UK general election

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at a microphone in Congress while a red-haired boy makes a funny face behind him.

props.synopsis: A mischievous six-year-old has gone viral for upstaging his congressman dad in the US House of Representatives.

title.children: 'This is what I get for asking my son to smile at the camera': US politician's speech overshadowed by six-year-old

image.altText: Man takes cash from ATM

props.synopsis: NDIS participants have been forced to hand over cash for criminals to buy drugs, and later harassed by the fraudulent providers.

title.children: How criminals are rorting NDIS participants for drug trafficking

image.altText: Young couple welcoming male and female guests at an apartment doorway, with smiles and arms outstretched.

props.synopsis: It was once a common way of staying in touch, but after we explored the etiquette of an unannounced visit, opinions were divided. This is what you had to say.

title.children: 'Who the hell in today's world has time?': Readers share their uncensored feelings about unannounced guests

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn gave police a detailed description of his attempts to "disappear from the scene" of the deaths of two retirees he was later accused of murdering, a court has heard.

title.children: Murder accused covered up campers' deaths in bid for 'a normal life', court hears

image.altText: image of woolworth building at mooroopna

props.synopsis: Shepparton man Matthew Atkinson has been sentenced to jail with a non-parole period of three years and six months for a fatal assault in Mooroopna last year where he punched and stomped on Mr Delphine's head twice.

title.children: 20yo sentenced to six years jail for fatal assault on Mooroopna man Bjorn Delphine at supermarket

image.altText: A woman in military uniform looks through a pair of binoculars on the deck of a ship.

props.synopsis: Foreign citizens living permanently in Australia will soon be able to serve in Australia's armed forces, as part of an effort to boost sluggish recruitment.

title.children: Confusion over which foreign citizens set to be allowed to join the ADF

image.altText: An aerial shot of Reef HQ aquarium in Townsville where a coral reef can be seen surrounded by buildings.

props.synopsis: Australia's Reef Authority had $80 million to repair and refurbish its showpiece aquarium in Townsville, but scrapped the project for a grander design it knew it could not pay for.

title.children: World's largest living coral reef exhibit closed indefinitely

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: A forensic scientist says the DNA of two people — Toyah Cordingley and an unknown person — was found on the young woman's fingernail clippings.

title.children: DNA of 'unknown' person found under murdered woman's fingernails, court hears

image.altText: A woman looks on with her hands behind her head.

props.synopsis: Cortnee Vine is among four debutants in Australia's women's football team heading to Paris without seven-time Olympic goalscorer Sam Kerr.

title.children: Trailblazers, record breakers, debutants and no Sam Kerr: Matildas name their Paris Olympics team

image.altText: Man and woman clapping as crowd hold small French flags.

props.synopsis: Gabriel Attal makes a surprise appearance at a radio debate next to fellow party member Valery Hayer, leading to accusations of mansplaining or "manterrupting".

title.children: French prime minister accused of mansplaining after surprise debate appearance

image.altText: A white care crashed on the side of the road, surrounded by police cars

props.synopsis: The two police officers are in a stable condition after both were allegedly rammed by a car in Tamworth while attempting to arrest a break-in suspect.

title.children: Two NSW police officers taken to hospital after allegedly being rammed by car

image.altText: Free range chickens at a farm in western Victoria.

props.synopsis: Farm Pride Foods announces the viral strain detected at its Lethbridge aviary site is "the same strain found on an egg farm at Meredith" around 10 days ago.

title.children: Third Victorian poultry farm declares bird flu outbreak

image.altText: A tornado

props.synopsis: A man who has pleaded not guilty to dozens of charges denies he told storm victims he held a builder's licence.

title.children: Man accused of defrauding couple who lost home in NSW tornado faces court

image.altText: A woman vacuuming the floors while a man sits on a couch and uses a laptop. The living room has plants and prints on the wall.

props.synopsis: Weaponised incompetence in relationships can keep women "locked into" traditional roles, experts say.

title.children: Explaining weaponised incompetence and how it 'keeps women busy' at home

image.altText: Interior of an aircraft looking down aisle.

props.synopsis: A quadriplegic teenager was unable to disembark a Virgin flight safely after the airline's own wheelchairs would not fit down the aisle of the plane, his mum says.

title.children: 'It's ridiculous': Quadriplegic teen stuck on flight because Virgin's own wheelchairs 'don't fit' plane aisle
